triples.name: Nondeterministic finite automaton
triples.relevance: The foundational automata model extended in the paper to support distributed games with asynchronous behavior.

triples.name: Perfect information
triples.relevance: The paper studies partial-information games, contrasting with games of perfect information.

triples.name: Safety property
triples.relevance: One of the key winning objectives addressed in the paper's algorithmic solutions.

triples.name: Parity game
triples.relevance: Parity objectives are a fundamental winning condition type analyzed in the paper.

triples.name: Finite-state machine
triples.relevance: The paper formulates the notion of finite-state distributed strategies for measuring distributed memory requirements.

triples.name: Game theory
triples.relevance: Provides the theoretical foundation for analyzing strategic interactions in distributed games.

triples.name: Automata theory
triples.relevance: Fundamental theoretical framework for modeling the non-deterministic asynchronous automata in distributed games.

triples.name: Distributed computing
triples.relevance: The core domain where distributed games are played with multiple cooperating processes.

triples.name: Strategy (game theory)
triples.relevance: The paper proposes novel constructions of distributed winning strategies with almost optimal memory.
